intro: Phyllanthus brittonii, commonly known as the Britton's phyllanthus, is a species of flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family, which includes many plants with unique floral structures. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers and is often found in sandy or disturbed soils. It has a low-growing habit and is adapted to thrive in coastal and inland dune environments. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
